assignment2

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment2.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class contains utility methods to perform basic File I/O operations.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rifat Shams
    See Also:
    File, FileNotFoundException, PrintWriter, ArrayList, Scanner

    • Method Detail

      • saveFileContents

        public static void saveFileContents(java.io.File f,
                                    java.lang.String s)
        Saves a string passed in s, in the file passed in f

        The method will create the file if it does not exist. The method will return without writing any content if the file is not a writable file (directory) or if it can not create the file

        Parameters:
        f - The file object where the string has to be written
        s - The string that has to be written in the file

      • getFileContentsAsString

        public static java.lang.String getFileContentsAsString(java.io.File f)
        Gets the content of the file f and returns as string

        The method reads one line from the file in a string and returns string. If the file does not exist, it returns a empty string.

        Parameters:
        f - The file to be read
        Returns:
        A string that are read from the file or empty string if the file does not exist

      • saveFileContents

        public static void saveFileContents(java.io.File f,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ar)
        Saves the list of strings passed in list ar, in the file passed in file f

        The method will create the file if it does not exist. The method will return without writing any content if the file is not a writable file (directory) or if it can not create the file

        Parameters:
        f - The file object where the strings has to be written
        ar - The array list containing the list of strings

      • getFileContentsAsArrayList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFileContentsAsArrayList(java.io.File f)
        Gets the content of the file f and returns as an array list

        The method reads each line from the file in a string and returns the list of strings. If the file does not exist, it returns a empty array list

        Parameters:
        f - The file to be read
        Returns:
        An array list containing the strings that are read from the file or empty list if the file does not exist

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists(java.io.File f)
        Checks if the file f exists or not
        Parameters:
        f - The file to check
        Returns:
        Returns true if the file exists or else returns false

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if a file exists or not in path s
        Parameters:
        s - The path of the file
        Returns:
        Returns true if the file exits or else returns false
